intro: Spermacoce manillensis, commonly known as the Manila sida, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release its seeds. Spermacoce manillensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
